title: Music Definitions
description: The music_definitions.json file defines which music tracks play in different biomes and game states. Each key is a biome or game state identifier that maps to music event configuration. Located at sounds/music_definitions.json in resource packs.

tokens.text: defines music tracks for biomes and game states

fields.title: Biome/State Music
fields.description: Music configuration keyed by biome identifier or game state (e.g., 'forest', 'desert', 'menu', 'creative', 'credits').

subForm.title: Music Definition
subForm.description: Defines the music event and playback timing for a biome or game state.

fields.title: Event Name
fields.description: The sound event identifier that plays music for this biome/state (e.g., 'music.overworld.forest', 'music.game.nether').

fields.title: Minimum Delay
fields.description: The minimum delay in seconds before the music starts playing after entering this biome or after the previous track ends.

fields.title: Maximum Delay
fields.description: The maximum delay in seconds before the music starts playing. The actual delay is randomly chosen between min_delay and max_delay.

note: This file is a JSON object where each key is a biome identifier (e.g., 'forest', 'desert', 'hell') or game state ('menu', 'creative', 'credits') and each value contains event_name, min_delay, and max_delay properties.
